column4: How can I get the source to a package that's in the repository?
Thank you so much Flannel
In the current directory it looks like ;)
I can do this as non-root too?
Are packages supposed to have the -dev requirements in their dependencies? I just did apt-get source nautilus-open-terminal and ./configure but it's missing some -dev libraries
so install the libs it tells you that are missing
I will, but is it not possible to have these installed for me with apt-get source?
apt-get source does not grab all the dependencies like apt-get install
Thanks, I guess I can manually install the deps
you might also look into checkinstall if you are installing from the source
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CheckInstall
Yeah, I know about CheckInstall, but it fails a lot on me. Do most packages have a make deb?
How long does it take for a patch I make to hit a repo? A lot of people complain about bugs, and I would like to fix them more often and not send out .debs to them.
subscribe to the bug at launchpad and you can keep yourself informed on the status and potential workarounds for bugs
of course it all depends on the severity of the bug :)
I am an experienced developer, just not familar with Ubuntu
I am more interested in fixing the bugs than reporting them
you could run the beta version of the next version due out in October -- code named Karmic Koala, join #ubuntu+1
How do most makefiles do creating debs? Or do they rely on checkinstall mostly
I never used a makefile to create a .deb; however I have used subversion to compile the latest and greatest of a few apps I choose
#ubuntu+1
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Subversion
if you're really serious you can ask about MOTU: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MOTU
